page.title: 06HOSPITALS AND HEALTH.
page.content: {Clayton Hospital}was built in 1854. It has 5 wards and a total of 100 beds. There are 25 doctors, 70 nursing staff and general and theatre porters. There are 2 large operating theatres and one smaller one for minor operations, also X-ray and physiotherapy departments. The meals for staff and patients are cooked in one big kitchen. The hospital has a pharmacy which supplies medecines for the patients. There are other health departments in Wakefield. {The Welfare Centre}is where the elderly,blind and physically handicapped people go for company and to make trays and stools.{The Speech {Therapy department}has 10 therapists who teach children who stammer or have cleft palates to talk properly. They also teach adults who have had strokes, larynx operations or have been involved in road accidents.
